title: Someone teach me stuffs D:
body:
i know absolutely 0% about pro games/teams and the worlds (even ranked is mostly a mystery to me)
but now that there are in-game prizes up for grabs, i now unfortunately have to learn really really fast! 
tell me what is common knowledge about who is good and who isn't and what i should know in regards of who to place my bets on.

i would just trust it to luck but i have the shittiest luck there is...

replies.body:
Come on. We all know that OCE > RU > NA > EU > China > KR
This is common knowledge man. 







Kappa

Previous winners in worlds:

SKT Telecom T1
Fnatic
TPA (Now disbanded)

Some very well known teams:
Fnatic, SKT Telecom T1 (AKA: SKT T1), TPA, Solo Mid (AKA: TSM).
There are other teams that are very well known, but to my knowledge these are the favourites in the worlds, as they have some very popular people:

SKT Faker
Bejercer (Can't spell, so forgive TSM fans)
sh*t, I forgot the rest, PEOPLE HELP ME

That's all i got atm :P
Soz

> [{quoted}](name=Zen Bot,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=ViKJAn3g,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-09-15T00:56:30.819+0000)

Bjergsen* :3

arent the ingame prizes just summoner icons and championship riven? (which you can only get by predicting every group and knockout stage match)
it doesnt matter what anyone thinks if you dont watch their gameplay your guess is as good as anyones. preparation for the most important league event of the year means teams are probably gonna want consistency over anything else. in every match between a much better team and the other, the game gets out of control when the 1st mistake/s are made and its impossible to come back. to form any honest and genuine belief of an opinion of the potential outcomes you have to know a lot about every single player. so really the best thing to do is chuck the teams in the most likely outcome, watch worlds and heff fun
Bjergsen is always the right answer.

This is such a broad question!

* EDG from china (formerly the best domestic team in China, now the most recent international Champions at MSI) are looking very strong, despite their second seed position. They also have Pawn, 2014 World Champion mid laner.

* SKT have Faker, Faker is still a God, Wolf (their support) can still be a liability however.

* LGD are incredibly fun to watch, especially Godv in the mid lane, arguably the best Chinese mid laner. They also control minion waves better than almost any team I've ever seen. They also have 2014 World Champion ADC Imp, who is playing unbelievably well recently.

* FNATIC have been amazingly consistent this split, they also have Huni who is a fantastic top laner who I believe will transfer very well to 5.18.

* AHQ are always a wildcard (see season 2 Worlds where LMS team TPA took the title). Westdoor is a mental mid laner, amazing to watch and one of the veterans of the scene.

These would be my teams to watch for this event, completely opinion based though! We don't have enough international data on these teams, it's largely theoretical at this point, with a new patch and these teams coming from different meta's so be careful getting advice from anywhere!

My recommendation would be to peruse [Loleventvods](https://www.reddit.com/r/LoLeventVoDs) and make up your own mind!

Watching China's Regionals is a good idea too as they were played on 5.16, the closest patch to the one they'll be playing on for worlds.

> [{quoted}](name=Atlus,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=ViKJAn3g,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-09-15T02:45:13.545+0000)
>
> This is such a broad question!
> 
> * EDG from china (formerly the best domestic team in China, now the most recent international Champions at MSI) are looking very strong, despite their second seed position. They also have Pawn, 2014 World Champion mid laner.

> * FNATIC have been amazingly consistent this split, they also have Huni who is a fantastic top laner who I believe will transfer very well to 5.18.

> 
> These would be my teams to watch for this event, completely opinion based though! We don't have enough international data on these teams, it's largely theoretical at this point, with a new patch and these teams coming from different meta's so be careful getting advice from anywhere!
> 
> My recommendation would be to peruse [Loleventvods](https://www.reddit.com/r/LoLeventVoDs) and make up your own mind!
> 
> Watching China's Regionals is a good idea too as they were played on 5.16, the closest patch to the one they'll be playing on for worlds.

I don't know if I agree that wolf is a liability. I would say Marin can be more of a liability, sure he has great carry potential but often plays forward with no vision even when he has his trinket ward available to use. Does give up first blood often when it could've been avoided.

EDG is looking good can't argue with that but I don't think they are looking as strong as they did at MSI.

Imp is looking like a boss again, his aggressive positioning on kog and his twitch play are lethal.

Huni can come up huge for Fnatic I wonder if there strategy will be just to get farm on to rekkles(sp)

Don't know too much about ahq west door is a tf freak tho.

I think the key to winning worlds will once again be the synergy between jungle and support going on roams and getting key vision. I think KT have great synergy there despite getting 3-0 by SKT in champions final.

I can't see any wildcard or NA teams making it out of pool play
thank you so much, this is very helpful getting a base for everything (cos I'm pretty ignorant atm)

- You can go to http://na.lolesports.com/news/power-rankings 
These are the scores for each team internationally in the LCS

- Previous winners who have made it into group stages this year are SKT and Fnatic

- You can also go to http://na.lolesports.com/news or http://na.lolesports.com/news/the-breakdown
This is to view any news or information about teams and breakdowns of previous games

Hope this helped a little! :D
